member.name: T:DDInt.Common.CEM
member.summary: The CEM (shorthand for CommonErrorManagement) is a set of static methods for raising exceptions through a standard manner. By using these methods to raise exceptions, we can trace all exceptions thrown by the common layer, obtain error strings from a resource file and map error conditions to the appropriate exception.

member.name: P:DDTek.Common.CommonStrings.Description_ConnectionPoolBehavior
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Specifies the connection pool algorithm used by the pooling mechanism. When set to LeastRecentlyUsed (the default), the pooling mechanism organizes connections in the pool using a queue processing technique. When set to MostRecentlyUsed, pooling mechanism organizes connections in the pool using a stack technique. When set to MostFrequentlyUsed, the pooling mechanism keeps track of how many times a connection has been used from the pool and provides the connection with the highest count when a connection is [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: P:DDTek.Common.CommonStrings.Description_ConnectionRetryCount
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The number of times the data provider tries to connect to the primary server, and, if specified, the alternate servers after the initial unsuccessful attempt..

member.name: P:DDTek.Common.CommonStrings.Description_ConnectionRetryDelay
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The number of seconds the data provider waits after the initial unsuccessful connection attempt before retrying a connection to the primary server, and, if specified, the alternate servers..

member.name: P:DDTek.Common.CommonStrings.Description_ConnectionTimeout

member.name: P:DDTek.Common.CommonStrings.Description_MaxPoolSizeBehavior
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to When set to HardCap (the default), the pooling mechanism will not allow more than MaxPoolSize connections to be created. When set to SoftCap, if MaxPoolSize connections are in use and another connection is requested, a new connection will be created. However, the pooling mechanism will not allow more than MaxPoolSize connections to be pooled..

member.name: P:DDTek.Common.CommonStrings.Description_MinPoolSize

members.member: Time/date/timestamp value.

Constructor.
TimestampEscape ::= _LeftBrace _TS _StringLiteral ...
Validate the time/date/timestamp value, since the parser only recognizes a string literal. The contents of the string literal were not checked.

Returns the year (yyyy) value for the yyyy-mm-dd or yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss[.f...] escape formats; null, otherwise.
@return the year value for ODBC 'd' and 'ts' escapes; null, otherwise.

Returns the month (mm) value from the yyyy-mm-dd or yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss[.f...] escape formats; null, otherwise.
@return the month value for ODBC 'd' and 'ts' escapes; null, otherwise.

Returns the day (dd) value from the yyyy-mm-dd or yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss[.f...] escape formats; null, otherwise.
@return the day value for ODBC 'd' and 'ts' escapes; null, otherwise.

Returns the hour (hh) value from the hh:mm:ss[.f...] or yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss[.f...] escape formats; null, otherwise.
@return the hour value for ODBC 't' and 'ts' escapes; null, otherwise.

Returns the minutes (mm) value from the hh:mm:ss[.f...] or yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss[.f...] escape formats; null, otherwise.
@return the minutes value for ODBC 't' and 'ts' escapes; null, otherwise.

Returns the seconds (ss) value from the hh:mm:ss[.f...] or yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss[.f...] escape formats; null, otherwise.
@return the seconds value for ODBC 't' and 'ts' escapes; null, otherwise.

Returns the time value in the ODBC format (hh:mm:ss[.f...]).
@return the time value in the ODBC format.

Returns the date value in the ODBC format (yyyy-mm-dd).
@return the date value in the ODBC format.

member.name: T:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyOptions
member.summary: Bitwise flag that specifies one or more options to use with an instance of DB2BulkCopy.

member.name: T:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopy
member.summary: Lets you efficiently bulk load a DB2 table with data from another source.
member.remarks:
The DB2BulkCopy class lets you write managed code solutions that provide functionality similar to Microsofts bcp command-line utility. There are other ways to load data into a DB2 table (INSERT statements, for example), but DB2BulkCopy offers a significant performance advantage over them.
The DB2BulkCopy class can be used to write data only to DB2 tables. However, the data source is not limited to DB2r; any data source can be used, as long as the data can be loaded to a DataTable instance or read with a IDataReader instance.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopy.#ctor(DDTek.DB2.DB2Connection)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DB2BulkCopy class using the specified open instance of DB2Connection.
member.param: The already open DB2Connection instance that will be used to perform the bulk copy operation.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopy.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes and opens a new instance of DB2Connection based on the supplied connectionString. The constructor uses the DB2Connection to initialize a new instance of the DB2BulkCopy class.
member.param: The string defining the connection that will be opened for use by the DB2BulkCopy instance.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopy.#ctor(System.String,DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyOptions)
member.summary: Initializes and opens a new instance of DB2Connection based on the supplied connectionString. The constructor uses that DB2Connection to initialize a new instance of the DB2BulkCopy class. The DB2Connection instance behaves according to options supplied in the copyOptions parameter.
member.param: The string defining the connection that will be opened for use by the DB2BulkCopy instance.
A combination of values from the DB2BulkCopyOptions enumeration that determines which data source rows are copied to the destination table.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopy.#ctor(DDTek.DB2.DB2Connection,DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyOptions,DDTek.DB2.DB2Transaction)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DB2BulkCopy class using the supplied existing open instance of DB2Connection. The DB2BulkCopy instance behaves according to options supplied in the copyOptions parameter. If a non-null DB2Transaction is supplied, the copy operations will be performed within that transaction.
member.param: The already open DB2Connection instance that will be used to perform the bulk copy.
A combination of values from the DB2BulkCopyOptions enumeration that determines which data source rows are copied to the destination table.
An existing DB2Transaction instance under which the bulk copy will occur.

member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.summary: Closes the DB2BulkCopy instance.

member.param: A DataTable whose rows will be copied to the destination table.
A value from the DataRowState enumeration. Only rows matching the row state are copied to the destination.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopy.BatchSize
member.summary: Number of rows in each batch. At the end of each batch, the rows in the batch are sent to the server.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopy.BulkCopyTimeout
member.summary: Number of seconds for the operation to complete before it times out.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopy.ColumnMappings
member.summary: Returns a collection of DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping items. Column mappings define the relationships between columns in the data source and columns in the destination.
member.remarks:
If the data source and the destination table have the same number of columns, and the ordinal position of each source column within the data source matches the ordinal position of the corresponding destination column, the ColumnMappings collection is unnecessary. However, if the column counts differ, or the ordinal positions are not consistent, you must use ColumnMappings to make sure that data is copied into the correct columns.
During the execution of a bulk copy operation, this collection can be accessed, but it cannot be changed. Any attempt to change it will throw an InvalidOperationException.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopy.DestinationTableName
member.summary: Name of the destination table on the server.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopy.NotifyAfter
member.summary: Defines the number of rows to be processed before generating a notification event.

member.name: T:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping
member.summary: Defines the mapping between a column in a DB2BulkCopy instance's data source and a column in the instance's destination table.
member.remarks:
Column mappings define the mapping between data source and the target table.
If mappings are not definedâ€”that is, the ColumnMappings collection is emptyâ€”the columns are mapped implicitly based on ordinal position. For this to work, source and target schemas must match. If they do not, an InvalidOperationException is thrown.
If the ColumnMappings collection is not empty, not every column present in the data source has to be specified. Those not mapped by the collection are ignored.
You can refer to source and target columns by either name or ordinal. You can mix by-name and by-ordinal column references in the same mappings collection.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor that initializes a new DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping object.
member.remarks: If you use this constructor, you must then define the source for the mapping using the SourceColumn property or the SourceOrdinal property, and define the destination for the mapping using the DestinationColumn property or the DestinationOrdinal property.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new column mapping, using column ordinals to refer to source and destination columns.
member.param: The ordinal position of the source column within the data source.
The ordinal position of the destination column within the destination table.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new column mapping, using a column ordinal to refer to the source column and a column name for the target column.
member.param: The ordinal position of the source column within the data source.
The name of the destination column within the destination table.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new column mapping, using a column name to refer to the source column and a column ordinal for the target column.
member.param: The name of the source column within the data source.
The ordinal position of the destination column within the destination table.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new column mapping, using column names to refer to source and destination columns.
member.param: The name of the source column within the data source.
The name of the destination column within the destination table.

member.summary: Name of the column being mapped in the destination database table.
member.remarks: The DestinationColumn and DestinationOrdinal properties are mutually exclusive. The last value set takes precedence.
member.returns: The string value of the DestinationColumn property.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping.DestinationOrdinal
member.summary: Ordinal value of the destination column within the destination table.
member.remarks: The DestinationColumn and DestinationOrdinal properties are mutually exclusive. The last value set takes precedence.
member.returns: The integer value of the DestinationOrdinal property, or -1 if the property has not been set.

member.remarks: The SourceColumn and SourceOrdinal properties are mutually exclusive. The last value set takes precedence
member.returns: The string value of the SourceColumn property.

member.summary: The ordinal position of the source column within the data source.
member.remarks: The SourceColumn and SourceOrdinal properties are mutually exclusive. The last value set takes precedence
member.returns: The integer value of the SourceOrdinal property.

member.name: T:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyColumnMappingCollection
member.summary: Collection of DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping objects that inherits from CollectionBase.
member.remarks:
Column mappings define the mapping between data source and the target table.
If mappings are not definedâ€”that is, the ColumnMappings collection is emptyâ€”the columns are mapped implicitly based on ordinal position. For this to work, source and target schemas must match. If they do not, an InvalidOperationException is thrown.
If the ColumnMappings collection is not empty, not every column present in the data source has to be specified. Those not mapped by the collection are ignored.
You can refer to source and target columns by either name or ordinal. You can mix by-name and by-ordinal column references in the same mappings collection.

member.summary: Adds the specified mapping to the DB2BulkCopyColumnMappingCollection.
member.param: The DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping object that describes the mapping to be added to the collection.

member.summary: Creates a new DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping and adds it to the collection, using ordinals to specify both source and destination columns.
member.remarks: Mappings in a collection must be uniform: either all integer/integer pairs, all string/string pairs, all integer/string pairs, or all string/integer pairs. If you try to add a mapping that is different from others already in the collection, an InvalidOperationException is thrown.
member.param: The ordinal position of the source column within the data source.
The ordinal position of the destination column within the destination table.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyColumnMappingCollection.Add(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping and adds it to the collection, using an ordinal for the source column and a string for the destination column.
member.remarks: Mappings in a collection must be uniform: either all integer/integer pairs, all string/string pairs, all integer/string pairs, or all string/integer pairs. If you try to add a mapping that is different from others already in the collection, an InvalidOperationException is thrown.
member.param: The ordinal position of the source column within the data source.
The name of the destination column within the destination table.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyColumnMappingCollection.Add(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping and adds it to the collection, using a column name to describe the source column and an ordinal to specify the destination column.
member.remarks: Mappings in a collection must be uniform: either all integer/integer pairs, all string/string pairs, all integer/string pairs, or all string/integer pairs. If you try to add a mapping that is different from others already in the collection, an InvalidOperationException is thrown.
member.param: The name of the source column within the data source.
The ordinal position of the destination column within the destination table.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyColumnMappingCollection.Add(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping and adds it to the collection, using column names to specify both source and destination columns.
member.remarks: Mappings in a collection must be uniform: either all integer/integer pairs, all string/string pairs, all integer/string pairs, or all string/integer pairs. If you try to add a mapping that is different from others already in the collection, an InvalidOperationException is thrown.
member.param: The name of the source column within the data source.
The name of the destination column within the destination table.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyColumnMappingCollection.Clear
member.summary: Clears the contents of the collection.
member.remarks:
The Clear method is most commonly used when you use a single DB2BulkCopy instance to process more than one bulk copy operation. If you create column mappings for one bulk copy operation, you must clear the DB2BulkCopyColumnMappingCollection after the WriteToServer method and before processing the next bulk copy.
Performing several bulk copies using the same DB2BulkCopy instance will usually be more efficient from a performance point of view than using a separate DB2BulkCopy for each operation.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyColumnMappingCollection.Contains(DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a specified DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping object exists in the collection.
member.param: A valid DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping object.
member.returns: true if the specified mapping exists in the collection; otherwise false.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyColumnMappingCollection.CopyTo(DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the elements of the DB2BulkCopyColumnMappingCollection to an array of DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping items, starting at a particular index.
member.param: The one-dimensional DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping array that is the destination of the elements copied from DB2BulkCopyColumnMappingCollection. The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyColumnMappingCollection.IndexOf(DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping)
member.summary: Gets the index of the specified DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping object.
member.param: The DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping object for which to search.
member.returns: The zero-based index of the column mapping, or -1 if the column mapping is not found in the collection.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyColumnMappingCollection.Insert(System.Int32,DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping)
member.summary: Insert a new DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping at the index specified.
member.param: Integer value of the location within the DB2BulkCopyColumnMappingCollection at which to insert the new DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping.
DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping object to be inserted in the collection.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyColumnMappingCollection.Remove(DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping)
member.summary: Removes the specified DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping element from the DB2BulkCopyColumnMappingCollection.
member.param: DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping object to be removed from the collection.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyColumnMappingCollection.RemoveAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the mapping at the specified index from the collection.
member.remarks:
The RemoveAt method is most commonly used when you use a single DB2BulkCopy instance to process more than one bulk copy operation. If you create column mappings for one bulk copy operation, you must remove mappings that no longer apply after the WriteToServer method is called and before defining mapping for the next bulk copy. You can clear the entire collection by using the Clear method, or remove mappings individually using the Remove method or the RemoveAt method.
Performing several bulk copies using the same DB2BulkCopy instance will usually be more efficient from a performance point of view than using a separate DB2BulkCopy for each operation.
member.param: The zero-based index of the DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping object to be removed from the collection.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2BulkCopyColumnMappingCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping object at the specified index.
member.param: The zero-based index of the DB2BulkCopyColumnMapping to find.

member.name: T:DDTek.DB2.DB2CommandBuilder
member.summary: Automatically generates single-table commands that are used to reconcile changes made to a DataSet with the associated database. A DB2CommandBuilder object is associated with a DB2DataAdapter object.
member.remarks: Using a CommandBuilder object can have a negative effect on performance. Because of concurrency restrictions, the CommandBuilder does not generate efficient SQL statements. The end-user can often write more efficient update and delete statements than those that the CommandBuilder generates.

member.name: T:DDTek.DB2.DB2CloseBehavior
member.summary: Controls the close behavior of an open connection. By default the connection is always returned to the pool. If set to DoNotPool, the connection is disqualified from the pool, disposed of and its resources are cleaned up. The connection pool replaces the disqualified connection to guarantee minimum pool size boundaries are enforced.

member.summary: Reflects the value of the Cache Column Info connection string option. That connection option controls whether or not the cursor description cache is enabled. By default it is enabled. member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2Connection.CharsetFor65535
member.summary: Returns a string containing the IANA name of the encoding scheme in effect for binary data. By default, this is an empty string; binary data will be reported as being binary. If the data needs to be interpreted as a charater string this property indentifies the encoding scheme that needs to be used.

member.summary: Gets or sets the string used to open a database.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2Connection.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary: Gets the time to wait while trying to establish a connection, before terminating the attempt and generating an error.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2Connection.CurrentUser
member.summary: Gets or Sets the current user. Property is used to control impersonation of user specified in connection string. Default value is empty string. Property can only be set when the connection is not open.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2Connection.CurrentUserAffinityTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the affinity timeout associated with the CurrentUser property. The value is expressed in milliseconds. The property helps the connection pool avoid performing unneccessary reauthentication. If CurrentUser is specified, Open will occur more quickly if the connection pool contains a physical connection that matches the specified CurrentUser. Increasing the CurrentUserAffinityTimeout can increase the chances that the connection pool will contain a physical connection that matches the desired CurrentUser. However, when set too high, the connection pool might have to create new connections, which is more performance-expensive than reauthenticating an existing connection.

member.summary: Gets the IANA name of the current database encoding scheme in effect. For databases that support multiple encoding schemes at the same time, this is the SingleByteCharacterSet (SBCS) encoding scheme.

The initial default is False.

The initial default is the serverâ€™s default system catalog schema.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.CharsetFor65535
member.summary: Gets or sets a character set from which to convert when fetching character columns (char, varchar, longvarchar, clob, char for bit data, varchar for bit data, longvarchar for bit data) defined with Coded Character Set Identifier (CCSID) 65535.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.CommonWorkArounds
member.summary: Common Work Arounds

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.ConnectionPoolBehavior
member.summary: Specifies the connection pool algorithm used by the pooling mechanism. When set to LeastRecentlyUsed (the default), the pooling mechanism organizes connections in the pool using a queue processing technique. When set to MostRecentlyUsed, pooling mechanism organizes connections in the pool using a stack technique. When set to MostFrequentlyUsed, the pooling mechanism keeps track of how many times a connection has been used from the pool and provides the connection with the highest count when a connection is requested. When set to LeastFrequentlyUsed, the pooling mechanism keeps track of how many times a connection has been used from the pool and provides the connection with the lowest count when a connection is requested. The value is ignored when Reauthentication Enabled=True.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.CreatePackage
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether to explicitly force the binding or rebinding of the packages needed by the data provider.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.ConnectionReset
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether a connection that is removed from the connection pool for reuse by an application will have its state reset to the initial configuration settings of the connection.

summary.para: Gets or sets the number of times the data provider tries after the initial attempt to connect to the primary server, and, if specified, the alternate servers after the initial unsuccessful attempt.
The value can be any integer from 0 to 65535.
When set to 0 (the initial default), the data provider does not try to reconnect after the first unsuccessful attempt.

Gets or sets the number of seconds the data provider waits after the initial unsuccessful connection attempt before retrying a connection to the primary server, and, if specified, the alternate servers.
The value can be any integer from 0 to 65535. The initial default is 3 (seconds). When set to 0, there is no delay between retrying the connection.

Gets or sets the number of seconds after which the attempted connection to the DB2 server will fail if not yet connected. If connection failover is enabled, this option applies to each connection attempt.
When set to 0, the data provider never times out on a connection attempt.
The initial default is 30 seconds.
Specifies the default path to be used when searching for functions or stored procedures.
The initial default is the default specified by the system.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.CurrentSchema
member.summary: Specifies the default schema to be used when executing queries. The initial default is the value for the User ID option.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.CursorDescriptionCache
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the Cursor Description Cache connection string option, which controls whether or not the cursor description cache is enabled. By default, the cache is enabled. The cache is used to reduce the number of round trips made to the server when executing SELECT statements.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.DatabaseName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the database to which you want to connect.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.Database
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the database to which you want to connect.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.DefaultQualifier
member.summary: Gets or sets the default qualifier to be used when binding the packages. This option applies only when packages are bound or rebound. The initial default is the value for User ID.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.DefaultSchemaRestriction
member.summary: Gets or sets the default Schema restriction to be used when no Schema restriction is specified in a call to GetSchema. The initial default is an empty string.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.DeferPrepare
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the DB2 data provider defers doing a Prepare on the database until the first execute of the statement.

summary.para: Gets or sets the number of sections to be provided when binding the packages to the database. This figure limits the number of concurrent open SQL statements at the server for this connection and cannot be higher than the value used when the packages were created.
The initial default is 200.
Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the provider should Enable Manual Enlistment.
The initial default is False.
Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether tracing is enabled.
The initial default is False.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.EnableXA
member.summary: The option provides a workaround for tools such as LightSwitch that presume the underlying provider is able to promote a local transaction to a fully distributed transaction on an as-needed basis,something the provider cannot currently do. Use the value False to employ the workaround.

remarks.para: This property enables or disables the XA support on client side.
The initial default is an true.

summary.para: Defines the how the provider encrypts data between the provider and the data source.

Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the data provider automatically attempts to enlist the connection in creating the threadâ€™s current transaction context. This option is enabled only when the data provider is installed with a Server license and the optional MS DTC Support components were selected.
When set to false (the initial default), the data provider does not automatically attempt to enlist the connection.
Gets or sets the User ID or user group that must be authorized to execute the packages. This option is valid only when binding or rebinding the data providerâ€™s packages.
The initial default is PUBLIC.
Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether a grant is to be executed when binding or rebinding the data providerâ€™s packages.
When set to true, the grant is executed.
When set to false (the initial default), the grant is not executed.

Gets or sets either the name or the IP address of the server to which you want to connect. For example, if your network supports named servers, you can specify a server name such as DB2server. Or, you can specify an IP address such as 199.226.224.34.
To connect to a DB2 server running on the local machine, specify localhost as the Host option.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.HostNameInCertificate
member.summary: Defines the host name in the certificate used as part of the SSL Server Certificate validation

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.InitialCommandTimeout
member.summary: Specifies the default timeout (in seconds) before the data provider terminates the attempt to execute the command and generates an error. The initial default value is 30 seconds.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.InitializationString
member.summary: Gets or sets a SQL statement to be automatically executed everytime a connection is establised to the database. The SQL may not return results.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.IsolationLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the default isolation level to be used when executing queries.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.LicensePath
member.summary: Gets or sets the fully-qualified path to the DDTek.lic license file. The license file is installed by default in the product installation directory, for example, C:\install_dir\DDTek.lic.

summary.para: Gets or sets the minimum number of seconds to keep connections in a connection pool. The Min Pool Size connection string option can cause some connections to ignore this value.
The value can be any integer from 0 to 65535.
When set to 0 (the initial default), the connections have the maximum timeout.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.LoadBalancing
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that determines whether the data provider uses client load balancing in its attempts to connect to primary and alternate database servers. The list of alternate servers is specified by the AlternateServers property.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.MaxPackageSectionCacheSize
member.summary: Max Package Section Cache Size

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.MaxPoolSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of connections within a single pool at any time. When the maximum number is reached, no additional connections can be added to the connection pool. The value can be any integer from 1 to 65535. The initial default is 100.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.MaxPoolSizeBehavior
member.summary: When set to HardCap (the default), the pooling mechanism will not allow more than MaxPoolSize connections to be created. When set to SoftCap, if MaxPoolSize connections are in use and another connection is requested, a new connection will be created. However, the pooling mechanism will not allow more than MaxPoolSize connections to be pooled.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.MaxStatementCacheSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of statements that can be held in the statement cache. Setting the cache size to 0 will disable statement caching.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the Max Statement Cache Size connection string option.

summary.para: Gets or sets the minimum number of connections are opened and placed in a connection pool when it is created. The connection pool retains this number of database connections, even when some connections have exceeded their Connection Lifetime value.
The value can be any integer from 0 to 65535.
When set to 0 (the initial default), no additional connections are placed in the connection pool when it is created.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.NewPassword
member.summary: Specifies a new password for the User ID following a successful connection. If the change of password fails for any reason, the connection to the server fails. The initial default is an empty string.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.PackageBindOptions
member.summary: Name-value pair list of generic package bind options.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.PackageCollection
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection or schema that the data provider uses to create the packages at bind-time. The data provider searches this collection or schema for the packages when they are needed. The initial default is NULLID.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.PackageOwner
member.summary: Gets or sets the owner to be used when binding or rebinding the packages. The initial default is the User ID.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.ParameterMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the parameter mode. The parameter mode controls the parameter marker format and the whether parameters are bound ordinally or by name.
member.remarks: This property corresponds to the Parameter Mode connection string option.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets a case-sensitive password used to connect to your DB2 database.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.PersistSecurityInfo
member.summary:
Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether to display secure information in clear text in the ConnectionString property and in the trace log.
When set to true, the value of the Password property is displayed in clear text. When set to false (the initial default),
the data provider does not display secure information in clear text.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.Pooling
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether connections are pooled. When set to true (the initial default), connection pooling is enabled.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.Port
member.summary: Gets or sets the port of the DB2 DRDA listener. The initial default is 446.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.QueryBlockSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the Query Block Size (in units of 32K) that the data provider requests from the server.
member.remarks:
This property affects the block size the server uses to return query data. The value is in units of 32K (actual block size is QueryBlockSize * 32K).
When set to 0, the data provider uses the default value of 4 (128K) when connecting servers that support QRYBLKSZ greater than 32K, and 1 (32K) for older servers. The data provider will not use a value greater than what the server will support. The initial default is 0.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.SchemaCollectionTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds after which the attempted schema collection operation to the DB2 server will fail if not yet completed.
member.remarks:
This property corresponds to the Schema Collection Timeout connection string option.
When set to 0, the data provider never times out on a schema collection operation attempt. The initial default is 120 seconds.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.SchemaOptions
member.summary: Bit flags that can be used control the amount of schema information returned by the GetSchema method.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value that specifies the security method the DB2 data provider uses to authenticate the user to the DB2 server:
When set to No Encryption (the initial default), the data provider sends the password in clear text.
When set to Encrypt Password, the data provider sends an encrypted password.
When set to Encrypt UserID and Password, the data provider sends an encrypted user ID and password.
Gets or sets a value that specifies the security method the DB2 data provider uses to authenticate the user to the DB2 server:
When set to No Encryption (the initial default), the data provider sends the password in clear text.
When set to Encrypt Password, the data provider sends an encrypted password.
When set to Encrypt UserID and Password, the data provider sends an encrypted user ID and password.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.SocketBufferSize
member.summary: Sets the send and receive buffer size (in KB) for the socket.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.SocketReceiveBufferSize
member.summary: Socket Receive Buffer Size

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.SocketSendBufferSize
member.summary: Socket Send Buffer Size

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.SortSequenceTable
member.summary: Specifies the value to be used for the packages' SORTSEQ option.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.StatementCacheMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the statement cache mode, The statement cache mode controls the behavior of the statement cache. Statements can be cached automatically or only cached when a command is explicitly marked.
member.remarks: This property corresponds to the Statement Cache Mode connection string option.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.TCPNoDelay
member.summary: Specifies the TCP_NO_DELAY Socket property which reduces network traffic by causing the socket to buffer packets

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.ThrottleCollectionsData
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether a provider returns very large collection meta data.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.TraceFile
member.summary:
Gets or sets the path and name of the trace file. The initial default is \DB2Trace.txt.
If the trace file does not exist, the data provider creates it.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.UseCurrentSchema
member.summary: Indicates whether the schema collection should automatically restrict using the current schema when the schema restriction is omitted.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.UserID
member.summary: Gets or sets the DB2 logon ID used to use for this connection.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.WorkArounds
member.summary: This property is reserved. Enter values only when directed by Progress DataDirect technical support.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder.XmlDescribeType
member.summary: Specifies whether the XML returned from a DB2 column is returned in the binary or character format.

member.name: T:DDTek.DB2.DB2DataReader
member.summary: Allows you to retrieve a read-only stream of rows from a database.
member.remarks: The DB2DataReader does not cache data in memory, which makes it a good choice when you must retrieve large amounts of data. Because only one row is in memory at any given time, system overhead is reduced.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2Strings.Description_DynamicSections

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2Strings.Description_EnableManualEnlistment

member.name: T:DDTek.DB2.DB2Trace
member.summary: Provides a set of methods and properties that help you to trace the execution of your code. The data provider can trace all of its method calls and the returns from those method calls to a trace file specified by the user.
member.remarks: Setting EnableTrace starts the tracing process. Therefore, you must define the property values for the trace file before setting EnableTrace. Once the trace processing starts, the values of TraceFile and RecreateTrace cannot be changed.

member.name: F:DDTek.DB2.DB2Trace.footprint
member.summary: Footprint information field

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DB2Trace.DumpFootprints
member.summary: Displays the footprint of all source files in a data provider.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2Trace.EnableTrace
member.summary: Enables tracing. By default, tracing is not enabled.
member.remarks: Setting EnableTrace starts the tracing process. Therefore, you must define the property values for the trace file before you enable tracing. Once the tracing process starts, the values of TraceFile and RecreateTrace cannot be changed.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2Trace.TraceFile
member.summary: Specifies the path and name of the trace file.
member.remarks: The initial default value is \DB2Trace.txt. If the trace file does not exist, the data provider creates it.

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2Trace.RecreateTrace
member.summary: Recreates the trace file each time the application restarts. By default, the trace file is appended.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DB2Transaction.Rollback

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2Transaction.IsolationLevel

member.name: P:DDTek.DB2.DB2Transaction.DbConnection
member.summary: Releases all of the resources that it owns. In addition, it calls its parent type's Dispose method, releasing all of the resources owned by the parent's types. By calling the Dispose method multiple times, all resources are released.

member.summary: Indicates we need to override the returned data for LOB columns on continueQuery.

member.name: F:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDARequest.ResultType
member.summary:
This field indicates the type of the result on which the reply processing is currently positioned. This value always contains one of RESULT_TYPE_... values defined
This field starts out with a value of RESULT_TYPE_UNKNOWN. When a QRYDTA token is found, it is set to RESULT_RESULTSET. When a SQLCARD token (which contains an update count) is found, it is set to RESULT_ROWS_AFFECTED. And, finally, when the entire reply has been processed, it is set to RESULT_NO_MORE_RESULTS.

member.name: F:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDARequest.NumRowsAffected
member.summary: This field contains the number of rows affected by a database operation. It is set by the code which processes the SQLCARD and/or RDBUPDRM tokens.

member.name: F:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDARequest.ProcessMode
member.summary: Contains one of the PROCESS_... values defined above. Controls the extent to which the reply is processed.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDARequest.EnsureBytes(System.Int32)
member.summary: This method ensures that we have enough data from our dataProvider to read the number of bytes specified. If not, then we need to ask for more data from the server, process up to the remaining data, and put the two pieces together in the buffer specified.
member.param: number of bytes we need to ensure to be present

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDARequest.SubmitRequest(System.Int32)
member.summary: Submits a request to the DB2 server * This base implementation provides some common initilization. In general, derivative classes should override this method to * (1) Discard any reply data remaining from a previous request, (2) Invoke this base class implementation to perform common initialization (3) construct the message, (4) send the message, and (5) set up to process reply.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDARequest.ContinueQuery
member.summary: Passthrough to sub-class fetches an additional 32K of data

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDARequest.ProcessReply
member.summary: This method encapsulates the details of interpreting the reply to a request. The method reads a token off the wire and calls processCodePoint (which is overridden in some derived classes) to process the codePoints inside the main DSS codePoint.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDARequest.ProcessCodePoint(System.Int16,System.Int16)
member.summary: This method encapsulates the details of interpreting reply messages and objects which are common in replies to several DRDA requests. *
member.param: Length of current codePoint
CodePoint to process

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDARequest.DiscardReplyBytes
member.summary: This method discards the remaining bytes in the reply for the current request.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDARequest.ProcessSQLCARD
member.summary:
This processes the DRDA SQLCARD object
SQLAM all levels: ***************** SQLCARD: SQLCAGRP (nullable): see processSQLCA

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDARequest.ProcessSQLCA
member.summary:
This processes the DRDA SQLCAGRP structure
SQLAM levels below 7: ********************* SQLCARD: SQLCAGRP (nullable): - SQLCODE I4 - SQLSTATE FCS(5) - SQLERRPROC FCS(8) SQLCAXGRP (nullable): see processSQLCAX
SQLAM levels >= 7: ****************** SQLCARD: SQLCAGRP (nullable): - SQLCODE I4 - SQLSTATE FCS(5) - SQLERRPROC FCS(8) SQLCAXGRP (nullable): see processSQLCAX SQLDIAGGRP (nullable): see processSQLDIAG

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDARequest.ProcessSQLDIAG
member.summary:
This processes the DRDA SQLDIAGGRP structure.
This structure is not yet documented and should be null otherwise throw an error.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDARequest.ProcessSQLCAX
member.summary:
This processes the DRDA SQLCAXGRP structure
SQLAM levels below 7: ********************* SQLCAXGRP(nullable): - SQLRDBNAME FCS(18) - SQLERRD1 I4 - SQLERRD2 I4 - SQLERRD3 I4 - SQLERRD4 I4 - SQLERRD5 I4 - SQLERRD6 I4 - SQLWARN0 FCS(1) - SQLWARN1 FCS(1) - SQLWARN2 FCS(1) - SQLWARN3 FCS(1) - SQLWARN4 FCS(1) - SQLWARN5 FCS(1) - SQLWARN6 FCS(1) - SQLWARN7 FCS(1) - SQLWARN8 FCS(1) - SQLWARN9 FCS(1) - SQLWARNA FCS(1) - SQLERRMSG_m VCM(70) - SQLERRMSG_s VCS(70)
SQLAM levels >= 7: ****************** SQLCAXGRP(nullable): - SQLERRD1 I4 - SQLERRD2 I4 - SQLERRD3 I4 - SQLERRD4 I4 - SQLERRD5 I4 - SQLERRD6 I4 - SQLWARN0 FCS(1) - SQLWARN1 FCS(1) - SQLWARN2 FCS(1) - SQLWARN3 FCS(1) - SQLWARN4 FCS(1) - SQLWARN5 FCS(1) - SQLWARN6 FCS(1) - SQLWARN7 FCS(1) - SQLWARN8 FCS(1) - SQLWARN9 FCS(1) - SQLWARNA FCS(1) - SQLRDBNAME VCS(255) - SQLERRMSG_m VCM(70) - SQLERRMSG_s VCS(70)

member.name: F:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDAStatementRequest.Columns
member.summary: This field contains zero or more DB2Column objects, which collectively describe the result set produced by a database operation. Each DB2Column object contains column metadata to be contained in ResultSetMetaData. This field should contain NULL if an operation does not produce a result set. The contents of this collection are constructed by the code which processes the OpenQuery reply tokens.

member.name: F:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDAStatementRequest.Parameters
member.summary: This field contains zero or more DB2Parameter objects, which collectively describe the parameters used in the database operation. This field should contain NULL if an operation does not use parameters.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDAStatementRequest.ProcessSQLCINRD
member.summary:
This processes the DRDA SQLCINRD object
SQLAM Level 7 or higher: ************************ SQLCINRD: SQLDHROW: SQLDHGRP(nullable): see processSQLDH SQLNUMROW: SQLNUMGRP: - SQLNUM I2 SQLDAROW: SQLDAGRP: see processSQLDA
SQLAM Levels below 7 ******************** SQLCINRD: SQLNUMROW: SQLNUMGRP: - SQLNUM I2 SQLCIROW: SQLCIGRP: - SQLCNAME_m VCM(30) - SQLCNAME_s VCS(30) - SQLCLABEL_m VCM(30) - SQLCLABEL_s VCS(30) - SQLCOMMENTS_m VCM(254) - SQLCOMMENTS_s VCS(254)

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDAStatementRequest.ProcessSQLDARD
member.summary:
This processes the DRDA SQLDARD object
SQLAM Level 7 or higher: ************************ SQLDARD: SQLCARD: see processSQLCARD SQLDHROW: SQLDHGRP: see processSQLDH SQLNUMROW: SQLNUMGRP: - SQLNUM I2 SQLDAROW: SQLDAGRP: see processSQLDA
SQLAM Levels below 7 ******************** SQLDARD: SQLCARD: see processSQLCARD SQLNUMROW: SQLNUMGRP: - SQLNUM I2 SQLDAROW: SQLDAGRP: see processSQLDA

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDAStatementRequest.ProcessSQLDA(System.Int32)
member.summary:
This processes the DRDA SQLDAGRP structure
SQLAM Level 7 or higher: ************************ SQLDAGRP: - SQLPRECISION I2 - SQLSCALE I2 - SQLLENGTH I8 - SQLTYPE I2 - SQLCCSID FB(2) SQLDOPTGRP(nullable): see processSQLDOPT
SQLAM Level 6 ************* SQLDAGRP: - SQLPRECISION I2 - SQLSCALE I2 - SQLLENGTH I8 - SQLTYPE I2 - SQLCCSID FB(2) - SQLNAME_m VCM(30) - SQLNAME_s VCS(30) - SQLLABEL_m VCM(30) - SQLLABEL_s VCS(30) - SQLCOMMENTS_m VCM(254) - SQLCOMMENTS_s VCS(254) SQLUDTGRP(nullable): see processSQLUDT
SQLAM Levels below 6 ******************** SQLDAGRP: - SQLPRECISION I2 - SQLSCALE I2 - SQLLENGTH I4 - SQLTYPE I2 - SQLCCSID FB(2) - SQLNAME_m VCM(30) - SQLNAME_s VCS(30) - SQLLABEL_m VCM(30) - SQLLABEL_s VCS(30) - SQLCOMMENTS_m VCM(254) - SQLCOMMENTS_s VCS(254)

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDAStatementRequest.ProcessSQLDH
member.summary:
This processes the DRDA SQLHGRP structure
SQLAM Level 7 or higher: ************************ SQLDHGRP(nullable): - SQLDHOLD I2 0 - cursor not held open across commit 1 - cursor held open across commit - SQLDRETURN I2 0 - default 1 - cursor defined using WITH RETURN CLIENT 2 - cursor defined using WITH RETURN CALLER - SQLDSCROLL I2 0 - non-scrollable cursor 1 - scrollable cursor - SQLDSENSITIVE I2 0 - statement is not related to a cursor 1 - cursor is SENSITIVE DYNAMIC 2 - cursor is SENSITIVE STATIC 3 - cursor is INSENSITIVE - SQLDFCODE I2 defines type statement using ISO SQL SQLStatement codes - SQLDKEYTYPE I2 0 - key type when the descriptor is not describing the columns of a query ex. describe input 1 - select list includes all the columns of the primary key of the base table referenced by the query 2 - the table referenced by the query does not have a primary key, but the select list includes a set of columns that are defined as the preferred candidate key - SQLDRDBNAM VCS(255) default rdbname the sqlstatement belongs to - SQLDSCHEMA_m VCM(255) - SQLDSCHEMA_s VCS(255) schema to which this sql statement belongs
SQLAM Levels below 7: ********************* This structure is not defined.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDAStatementRequest.ProcessSQLDOPT(DDTek.DB2.DB2Column,System.Int32)
member.summary:
This processes the DRDA SQLDOPTGRP structure
SQLAM Level 7 or higher: ************************
SQLDOPTGRP(nullable): - SQLUNNAMED I2 0 - columnname is not generated 1 - columnname is generated - SQLNAME_m VCM(255) - SQLNAME_S VCS(255) Mutually exclusive; the name of the column in MBCS or SBCS - SQLLABEL_m VCM(255) - SQLLABEL_s VCS(255) Mutually exclusive; the label of the column in MBCS or SBCS - SQLCOMMENTS_m VCM(255) - SQLCOMMENTS_S VCS(255) Mutually exclusive; the comment on the column in MBCS or SBCS SQLUDTGRP(nullable): see processSQLUDT SQLDXGRP(nullable): see processSQLDX
SQLAM Levels below 7: ********************* This structure is not defined.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDAStatementRequest.ProcessSQLUDT(DDTek.DB2.DB2Column)
member.summary:
This processes the DRDA SQLUDTGRP structure
SQLAM Level 7 or higher: ************************ SQLUDTGRP(nullable): - SQLUDTXTYPE I4 Contains the user defined type code for the structured data type. - SQLUDTRDB VCS(255) Default RDBName to which this UDT is defined - SQLUDTSCHEMA_m VCM(255) - SQLUDTSCHEMA_s VCS(255) Mutually exclusive; the name of the schema that owns this UDT in MBCS or SBCS - SQLUDTNAME_m VCM(255) - SQLUDTNAME_s VCS(255) Mutually exclusive; the name of the UDT in MBCS or SBCS
SQLAM Levels below 7: ********************* - SQLUDTNAME_m VCM(254) - SQLUDTNAME_s VCS(254) Mutually exclusive; the name of the UDT in MBCS or SBCS

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDAStatementRequest.ProcessSQLDX(DDTek.DB2.DB2Column)
member.summary:
This processes the DRDA SQLDXGRP structure
SQLAM Level 7 or higher: ************************ SQLDXGRP(nullable): - SQLXKEYMEM I2 0 - Column is not a member of the primary key 1 - Column is a member of the primary key - SQLXUPDATEABLE I2 0 - Column is not updateable 1 - Column is updateable - SQLXGENERATED I2 0 - Column is not generated 1 - Column was generated because of an expression 2 - Column was generated because of an identity 3 - Column was generated because a row was inserted into the table (ex. ROWID or other autoGen column) - SQLXPARMMODE I2 0 - Parameter not associated with a Stored Procedure 1 - Input parameter 2 - InputOutput parameter 3 - Output parameter - SQLXRDBNAM VCS(255) Default RDBName to which this field belongs - SQLXCORNAME_m VCM(255) - SQLXCORNAME_s VCS(255) Mutually exclusive; the table correlation name in MBCS or SBCS - SQLXBASENAME_m VCM(255) - SQLXBASENAME_s VCS(255) Mutually exclusive; the table to which the column belongs if this column is part of a resultSet, or the name of the storedProcedure if this parameter was part of a CALL statement, in MBCS or SBCS - SQLXSCHEMA_m VCM(255) - SQLXSCHEMA_s VCS(255) Mutually exclusive; the name of the schema that owns this field in MBCS or SBCS - SQLXNAME_m VCM(255) - SQLXNAME_s VCS(255) Mutually exclusive, either the name of the column or parameter in MBCS or SBCS
SQLAM Levels below 7: ********************* This structure is not defined.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDABindRequest.WriteSQLSTTVRB
member.summary:
SQLSTTVRB is the SQL Statement Variable Descriptions * This is a byte string that specifies information about the type of application variables that appear in a SQL statement. A description must be included for each variable in the SQL statement and each variable must be in the same order as they occur in the SQL statement. We use this when binding stored procedures. *
Ex. sql = CALL :H USING DESCRIPTOR :H The above sql statement has 2 sql variables, each of which need a descriptor * SQLSTTVRB layout:
- SQLNUMROW I2 (Int16) Number of parameters - SQLVRBROW (occurs SQLNUMROW times) - SQLPRECISION I2 (Int16) - precision of a fixed decimal field, 0 for other types - SQLSCALE I2 (Int16) - scale of a fixed decimal or zoned decimal field, otherwise 0 - SQLLENGTH I8(*)(Int64) - length of the field, not including the length field - SQLTYPE I2 (Int16) - Sql data type - SQLCCSID FB2 (Bytestring of 2 bytes) - 0 or the CCSID for this column - SQLNAME_m VCM 255 (Â°) - Name of the program variable(mbcs charstring). - SQLNAME_s VCS 255 - Name of the program variable(sbcs charstring). - SQLDIAGNAME_m VCM 255 - Fully qualified name of the program variable. - SQLDIAGNAME_s VCS 255 - Fully qualified name of the program variable. - SQLUDTGRP Nullable Group (**)
(*) SQLLENGTH is I4 for SQLAM lesser than 6 (Â°) length is 64 iso 255 for SQLAM lesser than 7 (**) SQLUDTGRP is present for SQLAM 7 and above
* @throws UtilException

member.name: T:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDAByteOrderedDataWriter
member.summary: DB2 ADO.NET Provider - DRDAByteOrderedDataWriter
member.author: Marc Ost

member.name: F:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDAByteOrderedDataWriter.END_OF_BUFFER
member.summary:
A constant which a caller can pass to "setPosition" to set the current insertion point back to the end of the buffered data.
Once "setPosition" is called with this value, subsequent calls to "put" methods will append data to the end of the used portion of "buffer".

member.name: F:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDAByteOrderedDataWriter.Communication
member.summary: This field contains the object through which all communication with the server takes place. It provides the ability to create request messages, process replies, etc.

member.name: F:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDAByteOrderedDataWriter.encodeInBigEndian
member.summary:
A boolean flag indicating whether the data written should be encoded in "big endian" (true) or "little endian" (false) format.
Big endian (also referred to as "network order") means that the most significant byte appears first, while the least significant byte appears last.

member.name: F:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDAByteOrderedDataWriter.Encoding
member.summary: The object used for character transliteration

member.name: F:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDAByteOrderedDataWriter.RequestBuffer
member.summary: This buffer contains the data written to this class via its "put" methods. The "send" method takes data from this buffer and transfers it to the network.

member.name: F:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDAByteOrderedDataWriter.CurrentBufferInsertPosition
member.summary: Indicates the position (in "buffer") at which the next byte will be placed.

member.name: F:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDAByteOrderedDataWriter.NumBytesPlacedInBuffer
member.summary:
Indicates the number of bytes which have been placed (by calls to "put" methods) into "buffer".
This field should not to be confused with the size of "buffer". If the "setPosition" method is called, this field may contain a value different from "currentBufferInsertPosition".

member.name: F:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDAByteOrderedDataWriter.bufferSizeIncrement
member.summary:
Indicates the size (in bytes) by which "buffer" will be expanded.
The number of bytes in "buffer" will always be a multiple of the value in this field.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDAByteOrderedDataWriter.writePacketHeader(System.Int16,System.Int16)
member.summary:
This method writes a new 6-byte packet header to the wire.
DRDA Packet Header is formatted as follows: byte 0-2: Two byte length field byte 3 : D0 (gds identifier) byte 4 : bits 0-3: DSS flags bit0 - encrypted (1-yes, 0-no) bit1 - packet chained (1-yes, 0-no) bit2 - continue on error (1-yes, 0-no) bit3 - chained packet has same corrId (1-yes, 0-no) must be 0 if bit1=0 bits 4-7: short DSS type (Request, Reply, Object, Communication) 1 - Request DSS 2 - Reply DSS 3 - Object DSS 4 - Communication DSS 5 - DSS where no reply is expected byte 5-6: Two byte correlation identifier *
member.returns: The position of the 2-byte length to fill in.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDAByteOrderedDataWriter.writeNewPacketHeaderWithLen(System.Int32,System.Int16,System.Int16)
member.summary: Writes a new packet header with length and returns you to the position you left off.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDAByteOrderedDataWriter.writePacketLength(System.Int32)
member.summary: Fills in the packet Length by calculating from current position.
member.param: Position to start writing length

member.summary: writeCodePoint: Writes 2 filler length bytes and the codePoint.
member.param: 2-byte DRDA codepoint to write.
member.returns: Position to write the length of the codepoint.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDAByteOrderedDataWriter.writeCodePointLength(System.Int32)
member.summary: writeCodePointLength: Writes in the 2 filler length bytes by calculating the length based on your current position. Since we calculate based on currentPosition, you need to call this in order just like curly braces.
member.param: Position to start writing the 2-byte length.

member.name: M:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDALoginRequest.WriteACCSEC(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
This method implements the details of writing the ACCSEC into the request.
SECMEC - Security Mechanism Values: 1 - DCESEC (Distributed Computing Environment Security) 2 - Not Used 3 - USRIDPWD (UserID / Password) 4 - USRIDONL (UserID only) 5 - USERIDNWPWD (UserID / Password / New Password) 6 - USERSBSPWD (UserID with Substitute PWD) 7 - USRENCPWD (UserID with Encrypted PWD) 8 - USRSSBPWD (UserID with Strong Substitute PWD) 9 - EUSRIDPWD (Encrypted UserID and Password) 10- EUSRIDNWPWD (Encrypted UserID, Password and New Password) 11- KERSEC (Kerberos Security) 12- EUSRIDDTA (Encrypted UserID and Security-sensitive Data) 13- EUSRPWDDTA (Encrypted UserID, Password, and Security-sensitive Data)

member.name: T:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDACommunication
member.summary: DB2 ADO.NET Provider - DRDACommunication
member.remarks: This class encapsulates all the details of sending data to the DBMS and receiving replies from it. An instance of this class represents a single (socket-based) connection to the DBMS. Each instance contains a number of objects which implement the UtilDataConsumer and UtilDataProvider interfaces. The layering of these objects ensures that the DRDA wire protocol specification is not violated.
member.author: Marc Ost

member.name: F:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDACommunication.footprint
member.summary: Footprint information field

member.summary: Statement template to be used to retrieve the primary key info from the catalog

member.summary: Default Schema for Catalog Queries

member.summary: An instance of UtilByteOrderedDataWriter, which is layered on top of the Socket object (m_tcpClient). This object allows data to be written in either big or little endian.

member.name: F:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDACommunication.Reader
member.summary: An instance of UtilByteOrderedDataReader, which is layered on top of the UtilBufferedDataProvider object. This object allows data to be read as either big or little endian.

member.summary: codepages used by the server

member.summary: codepages used by the client

member.name: F:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDACommunication.DDMAgentLevel
member.summary: Manager Levels. These levels tell us which DRDA functionality the server supports. DDMAgent - This is the DRDA listener that routes all DRDA requests to the appropriate DB2 manager SQLAM - SQL application manager handles processing of SQL semantics for the database. SYNCPTMGR -Sync point manager handles two-phase commit protocol as well as any XA functionality (recover etc...) RSYNCMGR - Handles syncronization of in-doubt requests. XAMGR - Handles all XA functionality starting at DRDA Level 5 CCSIDMGR - Coded CharacterSet Identifier manager handles converting character data between codepages. SECMGR - Security manager handles database permissions. CMNTCPIP - TCP/IP manager handles the TCP/IP protocol. *

member.name: T:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDAPkgNamCsn
member.summary: DB2 ADO.NET Provider - DRDAPkgNamCsn
member.remarks: DRDA executes SQLStatements by binding a sql statement to a specific package section at prepare time and then executing that section. This object is used to hold that information for each statement. When executing, you use the PKGNAMCSN token which consists of: RDBPackageName, consistency token, and section number However, when binding a new package, you just need a PKGNAMCT token which consists of: RDBPackageName and consistency token
member.author: Marc Ost

member.name: F:DDTek.DB2.DRDA.DRDAResultSetRequest.SQLAM6LOBReader
member.summary: This is used to read lob data on a different reader for SQLAM6LOB streaming. We do this so that lob processing doesn't affect our relative position in the returned resultset. For sqlam6, the entire resultset comes back (or the first 32K, whichever is less) and then you have to issue a seperate CNTQRY command to get the lob data. To avoid processing the entire resultSet first, we leave the current reader alone and substitute this reader just to get the lob data.

members.member: Contains the list elements. Even indices are index. Odd indices are nodes.

Sets the list element to the given value.
This is done buy "emptying" this current list value nodes (but leaving them intact), creating a sub-tree out of the new value, and making this new sub-tree a child of the last node in the original list.

Used to record positions of certain UPDATE/INSERT statemet clauses.
!!!REVISIT!!! Instead of recording positions of various clauses in the sqlProcessor, create a BaseSQLTreeNode nodes that encapsulate the meaning and search for it when processing the semantics of the statement. For example, BaseSQLTreeNode.NODE_TABLE_NAME node could be used to identify an UPDATE statement's table.
!!!REVISIT!!! Note that current check to see if sqlProcessor is null are no longer needed. In the past replaced clauses were re-parsed (e.g., escape translations). This is still true, but the parse level is always PROCESS_PARAMS, so no UPDATE/INSERT clauses are ever parsed.
Lexical analyzer.
Set by parsing methods to indicate the result of a sub parse

Each vector element is an array of two Objects. The first object, element [0], is the root node of the possibly qualfied table name. The second object, element [1], will be the root node of the correlation name.
tableInfo will be maintained when PROCESS_TABLES is on, and will only process table information in the context of a 'FROM' clause.
Note that instead of generic containers with casts, a new class for describing the table, and a new class to contain the new table class could be written.

Used to indicate the type of escape parsing required.

Constructor.
Setter of BaseExceptions.

* Parses the Statement non-terminal. * * Statement * ::= SelectStatement * NODE_STATEMENT_ROOT * $1 * * ::= InsertStatement * NODE_STATEMENT_ROOT * $1 * * ::= UpdateStatement * NODE_STATEMENT_ROOT * $1 * * ::= CreateStatement * NODE_STATEMENT_ROOT * $1 * * ::= DeleteStatement * NODE_STATEMENT_ROOT * $1 * * ::= UnknownStatement * NODE_STATEMENT_ROOT * $1

Parses the StatementList non-terminal.
StatementList ::= Statement StatementSeparator _EndOfStatementTerminal $1 -> [$2] -> $3
::= Statement StatementSeparator StatementList $1 -> [$2] -> $3
::= _EndOfStatementTerminal $1

Parses the CreateStatement non-terminal.
CreateStatement ::= _CREATE_TABLE AlmostAnything NODE_CREATE_STATEMENT $1 $2

Parses the SelectStatement non-terminal.
SelectStatement ::= QueryExpression OrderByClause ForClause NODE_SELECT_STATEMENT $1 -> [$2] -> [$3]

Parses the QueryExpression non-terminal.
QueryExpression ::= _SELECT List FromClause WhereClause GroupByClause HavingClause SetOperation NODE_QUERY_EXP $1 -> $2 -> [$3] -> $4 -> [$5] -> [$6] -> [$7]

Parses the DeleteStatement non-terminal.
DeleteStatement ::= _DELETE _FROM QualifiedName WhereClause NODE_DELETE_STATEMENT $1 -> $2 -> $3 -> $4

Parses the InsertStatement non-terminal.
InsertStatement ::= _INSERT _INTO QualifiedName ColumnList _VALUES ParenthesizedExpression NODE_INSERT_STATEMENT $1 -> $2 -> $3 -> [$4] -> $5 -> $6
::= _INSERT _INTO QualifiedName ColumnList SubQuery NODE_INSERT_STATEMENT $1 -> $2 -> $3 -> [$4] -> $5
::= _INSERT _INTO QualifiedName ColumnList _DEFAULT _VALUES NODE_INSERT_STATEMENT $1 -> $2 -> $3 -> [$4] -> $5 -> $6

Parses the UpdateStatement non-terminal.
UpdateStatement ::= _UPDATE QualifiedName _SET List WhereClause NODE_UPDATE_STATEMENT $1 -> $2 -> $3 -> $4 -> $5

Parses the QualifiedName non-terminal.
QualifiedName ::= _IdentifierOrUnknownKeyword(false) [ _Dot ... _IdentifierOrUnknownKeyword(false) ] ... NODE_UNKNOWN $1 -> [ $2 -> ... ]

Parses the UnknownStatement non-terminal.
UnknownStatement ::= UnknownStatementComponents NODE_UNKNOWN_STATEMENT $1

Parses the UnknownStatementComponents non-terminal.
UnknownStatementComponents ::= _EndOfStatementTerminal $1
::= _Parameter UnknownStatementComponents $1 -> $2
::= Escape UnknownStatementComponents $1 -> $2
::= _AnyToken UnknownStatementComponents $1 -> $2

Parses the List non-terminal.
List ::= AlmostAnything(true,false) NODE_LIST_PART $1

Parses the PredicateType non-terminal.
PredicateType ::= ComparisonPredicate ::= BetweenPredicate ::= InPredicate ::= LikePredicate ::= ExisitsPredicate

Parses the ComparisonPredicate non-terminal.
ComparisonPredicate ::= ValueExpression CompOp ValueExpression
CompOp ::= _Equal
::= _LessThan
::= _LessThanOrEqual
::= _GreaterThan
::= _GreaterThanEqual
::= _Unequal

Parses the BetweenPredicate non-terminal.
BetweenPredicate ::= ValueExpression BetweenExpression ValueExpression _And ValueExpression
BetweenExpression ::= Not_opt _Between

Parses the SetOperationLastPart non-terminal.
SetOperationLastPart ::= QueryExpression NODE_UNKNOWN $1
::= AlmostAnything(true,false) NODE_UNKNOWN $1

Parses the SetOperator non-terminal.
SetOperator ::= _UNION $1
::= _INTERSECT $1
::= _EXCEPT $1

Parses the ParenthesizedExpression non-terminal.
ParenthesizedExpression ::= _LeftParen AlmostAnything(false,true) _RightParen NODE_PAREN_ROOT $1 -> $2 -> $3

Parses the SubQuery non-terminal.
SubQuery ::= _LeftParen QueryExpression _RightParen NODE_PAREN_ROOT $1 -> $2 -> $3

Parses the Escape non-terminal.
Escape ::= CallEscape $1
::= FunctionEscape $1
::= OuterJoinEscape $1
::= TimeEscape $1
::= DateEscape $1
::= TimestampEscape $1
::= EscapeEscape $1

Parses the TimeEscape non-terminal.
TimeEscape ::= _LeftBrace _T _StringLiteral _RightBrace // Reduction only valid if FULL_TRANSLATION_NEEDED // is required for the TIME escape. NODE_TIME_ESCAPE $1 -> $2 -> 3 -> 4
::= _LeftBrace _T RestOfEscape NODE_UNKNOWN $1 -> $2 -> 3...

Parses the DateEscape non-terminal.
DateEscape ::= _LeftBrace _D _StringLiteral _RightBrace // Reduction only valid if FULL_TRANSLATION_NEEDED // is required for the DATE escape. NODE_DATE_ESCAPE $1 -> $2 -> 3 -> 4
::= _LeftBrace _D RestOfEscape NODE_UNKNOWN $1 -> $2 -> 3...

Parses the TimestampEscape non-terminal.
TimestampEscape ::= _LeftBrace _TS _StringLiteral _RightBrace // Reduction only valid if FULL_TRANSLATION_NEEDED // is required for the TIMESTAMP escape. NODE_TIMESTAMP_ESCAPE $1 -> $2 -> 3 -> 4
::= _LeftBrace _TS RestOfEscape NODE_UNKNOWN $1 -> $2 -> 3...

Parses the EscapeEscape non-terminal.
EscapeEscape ::= _LeftBrace _ESCAPE _StringLiteral _RightBrace // Reduction only valid if FULL_TRANSLATION_NEEDED // is required for the ESCAPE escape. NODE_ESCAPE_ESCAPE $1 -> $2 -> 3 -> 4
::= _LeftBrace _ESCAPE RestOfEscape NODE_UNKNOWN $1 -> $2 -> 3...

Parses the FunctionEscape non-terminal.
FunctionEscape ::= _LeftBrace _FN _ScalarFunctionName EscapeParameterList _RightBrace // Reduction only valid if FULL_TRANSLATION_NEEDED // is required for the FUNCTION escapes. NODE_FUNCTION_ESCAPE $1 -> $2 -> $3 -> $4 -> $5
::= _LeftBrace _FN RestOfEscape NODE_UNKNOWN $1 -> $2 -> $3...
Unless full translation is needed, the sub-tree is marked NODE_UNKNOWN, since the it will not require further translation work.

Parses the CallEscape non-terminal.
CallEscape ::= _LeftBrace _CALL QualifiedName EscapeParameterList _RightBrace // Reduction only valid if FULL_TRANSLATION_NEEDED // is required for the CALL_PROCEDURE escapes. NODE_CALL_PROCEDURE_ESCAPE $1 -> $2 -> $3 -> $4 -> $5
::= _LeftBrace _CALL RestOfEscape NODE_UNKNOWN $1 -> $2 -> $3...
::= _LeftBrace _Parameter _EqualOperator _CALL QualifiedName EscapeParameterList _RightBrace // Reduction only valid if FULL_TRANSLATION_NEEDED // is required for the CALL_FUNCTION escapes. NODE_CALL_FUNCTION_ESCAPE $1 -> $2 -> $3 -> $4 -> $5 -> $6 -> $7
::= _LeftBrace _Parameter _EqualOperator _CALL RestOfEscape NODE_UNKNOWN $1 -> $2 -> $3 -> $4 -> $5...
Common CallEscape endings are parsed via parseRemainingCallEscape.

Parses the OuterJoinEscape non-terminal.
OuterJoinEscape ::= _LeftBrace _OJ OuterJoin _RightBrace // Reduction only valid if FULL_TRANSLATION_NEEDED // is required for the OUTER_JOIN escapes. NODE_OUTER_JOIN_ESCAPE $1 -> $2 -> $3 -> $4
::= _LeftBrace _OJ RestOfEscape NODE_UNKNOWN $1 -> $2 ->3...
Unless full translation is needed, the sub-tree is marked NODE_UNKNOWN, since the it will not require further translation work.

Parses the OuterJoinOrTableReference non-terminal.
OuterJoinOrTableReference ::= OuterJoin $1
::= TableReference $1

Parses the JoinType non-terminal.
JoinType ::= _LEFT _OUTER _JOIN NODE_LEFT_OUTER_JOIN_OP $1 -> $2 -> $3
::= _RIGHT _OUTER _JOIN NODE_RIGHT_OUTER_JOIN_OP $1 -> $2 -> $3
::= _FULL _OUTER _JOIN NODE_FULL_OUTER_JOIN_OP $1 -> $2 -> $3
The method updates the type of the node as well.

Parses the TableReference non-terminal.
TableReference ::= QualifiedName CorrelationName NODE_TABLE_REFERENCE $1 -> [$2]

Looks ahead for certain join related keywords.
The state of the parser is unaffected by this method.

Parses the SearchCondition non-terminal.
SearchCondition ::= AlmostAnything(true,false); NODE_SEARCH_CONDITION $1
A search condition is everything up to the next ON keyword or until the end of the escape is encountered.

Parses the EscapeParameters non-terminal.
EscapeParameters ::= EscapeParameter _Comma EscapeParameters $1 -> $2 -> $3
::= EscapeParameter $1

Parses the EscapeParameter non-terminal.
EscapeParameter ::= EscapeParameterComponents NODE_ESCAPE_PARAMETER $1
A parameter is everything up to the next comma or right paren.

Parses the RestOfEscape non-terminal.
RestOfEscape ::= _EndOfStatementTerminal $1
::= _RightBrace(translationNeeded) $1
::= Escape RestOfEscape(translationNeeded) $1 -> $2
::= _Parameter RestOfEscape(translationNeeded) $1 -> $2
::= _AnyToken RestOfEscape(translationNeeded) $1 -> $2

Parses the GROUP BY terminals.
_GROUP_BY ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("group") TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("by") $1 $2

Matches the HAVING terminal.
_HAVING ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("having") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the ORDER BY terminals.
_ORDER_BY ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("order") TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("by") $1 $2

Matches the UNION terminals.
_UNION ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("union") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the INTERSECT terminals.
_INTERSECT ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("intersect") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the EXCEPT terminal.
_EXCEPT ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("except") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the BY terminal.
_BY ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("by") NODE_UNKNOWN

Parses the CREATE TABLE terminals.
_CREATE_TABLE ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("create") TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("table") $1 $2

Matches the SELECT terminal.
_SELECT ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("select") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the FROM terminal.
_FROM ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("from") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the WHERE terminal.
_WHERE ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("where") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the NOT terminal.
_WHERE ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("not") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the NULL terminal.
_NULL ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("null") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the EXISTS terminal.
_WHERE ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("exists") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the BETWEEN terminal.
_WHERE ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("between") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the LIKE terminal.
_LIKE ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("like") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the IN terminal.
_WHERE ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("in") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the ALL terminal.
_ALL ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("all") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the CORRESPONDING terminal.
_CORRESPONDING ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("corresponding") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the INSERT terminal.
_INSERT ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("insert") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the DELETE terminal.
_DELETE ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("delete") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the SET terminal.
_SET ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("set") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the INTO terminal.
_INTO ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("into") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the UPDATE terminal.
_UPDATE ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("update") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the VALUES terminal.
_VALUES ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("values") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the DEFAULT terminal.
_VALUES ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("default") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the ON terminal.
_ON ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("ON") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the CROSS terminal.
_CROSS ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("CROSS") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the INNER terminal.
_CROSS ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("INNER") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the JOIN terminal.
_CROSS ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("JOIN") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the USING terminal.
_CROSS ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("USING") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the LEFT terminal.
_LEFT ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("left") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the RIGHT terminal.
_RIGHT ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("right") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the FULL terminal.
_FULL ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("full") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the OUTER terminal.
_FULL ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("OUTER") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the OUTER JOIN terminals.
_OUTER _JOIN ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("outer") TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("join") $1 $2

Matches the OJ terminal.
_OJ ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("OJ") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the CALL terminal.
_CALL ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("CALL") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the EXT terminal.
_EXT ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("EXT") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the FN terminal.
_FN ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("FN") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches a special character terminal.

Matches the ';' terminal.

Matches the '=' terminal.
_EqualOperator ::= TOKEN_SPECIAL_CHAR("=") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the EOS terminal.
_EndOfStatementTerminal ::= TOKEN_END_OF_SQL NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches all tokens up to a TOKEN_END_OF_SQL or any TOKEN_SPECIAL_CHAR whose value is identified in the specified exceptList.
@return returns true if one or more tokens were matched; false, otherwise.
Indirection to the escape translator in case one was not provided.

Extracts parameter metadata identifying information for all predicates
Algorithm :
- Make a pass through the tree gathering all param nodes
- For each parameter node, search back up the tree towards the root looking for nearest predicate ancestor if any - adding such predicates to a list
- For each predicate node, identify the part of the predicate that can be used to describe the parameters contained in the predicate. Each predicate type has specific logic/code for determing this.
- Parameter metadata descriptions can be in two forms. It can be a sub query which produces a single value. Or it can be "anything else". If its a sub query, then the sub query minus anything past the 'where' clause describes the parameter. If it's not a sub query, then the "anything else" is used as column description in a secondary select statement built from the parts of the enclosing select statement.
If its a sub query, construct a new "where 0=1" select statement out of the sub query.
If its "anything else" construct select statement the enclosing select as the basis, with the "anything else" part as the column definition. Again with a "where 0=1" clause.
If an escape node is visited, then translate and replace the escape sub-tree.

Example (base 16) ----------------- To initialize "a" with the default value of 0x1D4F in base 16 BigInteger a = new BigInteger("1D4F", 16)

member.name: M:DDInt.Utility.UtilTransliterator.AliasToIANAName(System.String)
member.summary: Maps a character set alias to an IANA character set name. This mapping supports only the code pages implemented by DDTek.Util. Based on http://www.iana.org/assignments/character-sets with some additions
member.returns: Name or null if not found

member.name: M:DDInt.Utility.UtilTransliterator.AliasToICUMapName(System.String)
member.summary: Maps a character set alias to an ICU character map name. This mapping supports only the code pages implemented by DDTek.Util. Based on http://oss.software.ibm.com/cvs/icu/charset/data/ucm/
member.returns: Name or null if not found

member.name: M:DDInt.Utility.UtilTransliterator.CodepageToIANAName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Maps a Windows codepage nr to an IANA character set name. This mapping supports only the code pages implemented by DDTek.Util.
member.returns: Name or null if not found

member.name: M:DDInt.Utility.UtilTransliterator.CodepageToICUMapName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Maps a codepage nr to an ICU character map name. This mapping supports only the code pages implemented by DDTek.Util.
member.returns: Name or null if not found

member.name: M:DDInt.Utility.UtilTransliterator.IANANameToCodepage(System.String)
member.summary: Maps an IANA character set name to a codepage nr. This mapping supports only the code pages implemented by DDTek.Util.

member.name: M:DDInt.Utility.UtilTransliterator.ICUMapNameToCodepage(System.String)
member.summary: Maps an ICU character map name to a codepage nr. This mapping supports only the code pages implemented by DDTek.Util.

member.name: T:DDInt.Utility.UtilTransliteratorUsingICUTable
member.summary: Class defining the transliteration process for fragments, using mapping tables dowloaded from http://oss.software.ibm.com/icu/charset/

member.name: M:DDInt.Utility.UtilTransliteratorUsingICUTable.readByteSequence(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: This helper-method reads a byte sequence from the charmap that is formatted like this: \x42\x5B.... upto a maximum of 4 bytes and converts it to an Int32
member.param: string to read from
offset to start reading

member.name: M:DDInt.Utility.UtilTransliteratorUsingICUTable.buildConversionTables(System.IO.StreamReader)
member.summary: This method reads the entire contents of the ICU mappings file and constructs the unicodeToCharsetMapping, primaryCharsetToUnicodeMapping and secondaryCharsetToUnicodeMapping arrays.
member.param: StreamReader that provides the ICU map
